citations.narrative:
Required records are absent for acquisition and disposition of some of the animals. The licensee states there are no
records for 7 domestic chickens sold, 5 domestic goats sold and 7 domestic chicken purchased since October 2024. Full
documentation of regulated animals is essential for proper identification, tracking of animals and for APHIS Officials to be
able to carry out their duties. Facilities shall make and maintain complete records regarding the details of the acquisition
and disposition of animals in their possession in order to account for all animal transfers or deaths and the sources of the
animals. All information found within section 2.75(b)(1) should be recorded, maintained, and made available for
inspection.
Correct from this date forward of 01 August 2025.

There are sharp points present in the multispecies outdoor aviary housing 15 domestic chickens, 6 domestic ducks, 2
Lady Amherst's pheasants, 2 vulturine guineafowl, and 1 helmeted guineafowl. A metal mesh fastened into a tube
structure used to protect a plant was found on its side on the ground. The cut metal wires on either end of the tube felt
sharp and were accessible to the ground dwelling birds. Failure to ensure that no sharp points are present in enclosures
housing birds can result in injuries to the birds. The licensee must ensure that primary enclosures are constructed and
designed so that they have no sharp points or edges that could injure the birds. Corrected at the time of inspection.
Correct from this date forward of 01 August 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Required records are absent for acquisition and disposition of some of the animals. The licensee states there are no 
records for 7 domestic chickens sold, 5 domestic goats sold and 7 domestic chicken purchased since October 2024. Full 
documentation of regulated animals is essential for proper identification, tracking of animals and for APHIS Officials to be 
able to carry out their duties. Facilities shall make and maintain complete records regarding the details of the acquisition 
and disposition of animals in their possession in order to account for all animal transfers or deaths and the sources of the 
animals. All information found within section 2.75(b)(1) should be recorded, maintained, and made available for 
inspection.  
 
Correct from this date forward of 01 August 2025. 
3.153(a)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
There are sharp points present in the multispecies outdoor aviary housing 15 domestic chickens, 6 domestic ducks, 2 
Lady Amherst's pheasants, 2 vulturine guineafowl, and 1 helmeted guineafowl. A metal mesh fastened into a tube 
structure used to protect a plant was found on its side on the ground. The cut metal wires on either end of the tube felt 
sharp and were accessible to the ground dwelling birds. Failure to ensure that no sharp points are present in enclosures 
housing birds can result in injuries to the birds. The licensee must ensure that primary enclosures are constructed and 
designed so that they have no sharp points or edges that could injure the birds. Corrected at the time of inspection. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 01 August 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
